result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Michael Bump was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees or civil judgment will be entered with tax intercept.
All court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution, be paid through collection by DOC in an amount deemed reasonable from wages and from other monies held in the defendant's  inmate account under Sec. 973.02(11)(c) and as a condition  of Extended Supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment with tax intercept or other means.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with cases 15CF2081 and 15CF3391.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain employment and/or school.
Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Michael Bump

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS ATTN. RECORDS 2909 E PARK AVENUE CHIPPEWA FALLS WI 54729

AMENDMENT to Judgment of Conviction and Order - ERP

IT IS ORDERED

that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this Order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date. 

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED

that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release within SIX (6) working days upon receipt of this Order.

IN ALL OTHER RESPECTS THE ORIGINAL JUDGMENT HEREIN IS AFFIRMED.

Signed and filed, sdg.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br.33  Judge Ashley
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt: Certification of SENTENCING transcript commencing 01/25/17 received and filed. (22 Pages.) Copy of transcript forwarded to OTHER.

* Restitution payable to STEVE H for ONE HUNDRED FIFTY-SEVEN DOLLARS AND TWENTY-TWO CENTS ($157.22) or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during probation and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.

Defendant Christopher Michael Bump in court with attorney Meighan Martha Anger.  Defendant Christopher Michael Bump in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of FOUR (4) YEARS, with credit for TWO HUNDRED THIRTY-TWO (232) DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is TWO (2)  YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is TWO (2) YEARS.  The defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  CONCURRENT TO CASE(S) 15CF2081, 15CF3391.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol. 
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.
* Obtain and maintain employment and/or school.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount deemed reasonable from wages and from other monies held in in the defendants inmate account under Sec. 973.02(11)(c) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment WITH tax intercept or other means.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant Christopher Michael Bump in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer for Louis Edward Epps.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.

The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and elements/Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Per email from case manager.  Case is adjourned to 11-04-2015 at 1:30pm.  sdg

Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher Michael Bump in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Christopher Michael Bump in custody.  Ronald Dague for Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.
